page.title: 14COMMUNICATIONS WITH POLWARTH
page.content: THE A6105 ROAD IS THE CHIEF LINK IN THE AREA RUNNING FROM EARLSTON BY GREENLAW & DUNS TO BERWICK. BUSES ARE INFREQUENT & UNLESS A CAR IS OWNED, WHICH IT IS BY MOST, POLWARTH & MARCHMONT ARE MUCH MORE REMOTE THAN THEY WERE FOR THE HUNDRED YEARS UNTIL THE 1948 FLOOD SWEPT AWAY THE RAILWAY BRIDGES & MARCHMONT STATION WAS CLOSED, & SUBSEQUENTLY THE SUB POST OFFICE THERE. FOR THE SMALL MINORITY IN THE AREA WHO DO NOT HAVE A TELEPHONE THERE IS A PUBLIC BOX AT POLWARTH. THE POSTMAN IN A VAN DELIVERS LETTERS & PARCELS & ALSO COLLECTS THEM. THE BORDER COURIER DOES PASS ON WEEKDAYS ON ITS SLOW BUT POTENTIALLY USEFUL ROUND OF THE LOCAL HOSPITALS & CAN TAKE A FEW ( PATIENT) PASSENGERS & PARCELS.
